task: Aleksander Piech is playing a virtual competition. In this game, players score points by collecting coins and stars. Each coin is worth $c$ points, and each star is worth $s$ points. The first time Aleksander Piech played, he collected 29 coins and 15 stars, scoring 884 points. The second time, he collected 38 coins and 20 stars, scoring 1066 points. Which system of equations can be used to determine the values of $c$ and $s$?
explanation:
Choice A is correct. Aleksander Piech played a virtual competition where points are earned by collecting coins and stars.
Each coin is worth $c$ points, and each star is worth $s$ points. The first time Aleksander Piech played, he collected 29 coins and 15 stars, scoring 884 points.
The second time, Aleksander Piech collected 38 coins and 20 stars, scoring 1066 points.
Setting up the system of equations, we have:
$ 29c + 15s = 884 $
$ 38c + 20s = 1066 $
This forms the correct system of equations.
